Why Bitcoin $BTC  Could Outshine Gold, According to Cathie Wood Bitcoin may be the most scarce asset in the world possibly even more than gold. Cathie Wood, CEO of Ark Invest, says in her 2026 Outlook that Bitcoin‚Äôs fixed supply gives it a major advantage as institutional demand continues to grow.  In 2025, gold performed strongly, rising about 65%, while Bitcoin dipped slightly. However, Wood explains that gold supply can increase when prices rise because miners can produce more. Bitcoin is different its supply is mathematically capped and cannot be increased.  Over the next two years, Bitcoin‚Äôs supply will grow by only about 0.82% per year, and that rate will slow even more over time. Because of this limited supply, analysts like Bitwise CIO Matthew Hougan believe that if demand keeps rising, Bitcoin could see a sharp, parabolic price surge. #Bitcoin $BTC

$BTC Bitcoin stood at the edge of the chart like an old king pacing a narrow hallway. Up a little. Down a little. Sideways, always sideways. Traders watched the candles form, but no one believed the pumps anymore. Every green spike felt like a trap, every dip a rehearsal for the same range. The king had cried wolf too many times.
Liquidity stayed cautious. Volume whispered instead of roared. Bitcoin didn‚Äôt fall‚Äîbut it didn‚Äôt lead either. It simply waited.
That‚Äôs when the smaller banners began to move.
Sui slipped first, quiet and precise, building while eyes were elsewhere. Walrus followed, storing value like a secret archive beneath the noise. DeepBook woke next, pulling liquidity into places Bitcoin no longer reached. Then IKA‚Äîfast, sharp, and underestimated‚Äîstitched the momentum together.
No trumpets sounded. No influencers screamed. The charts just‚Ä¶ shifted.
While Bitcoin marched in place, capital flowed sideways too‚Äîinto the altcoins. Green candles appeared where no one was watching. Doubters laughed at first, then checked their portfolios twice. By the time they understood, the season already had a name.
Bitcoin remained the gravity of the market, unmoved and untrusted. But around it, the smaller worlds bloomed.
And somewhere between disbelief and quiet profit, altcoin season began‚Äînot with a pump, but with everyone looking the wrong way. üåäüìà

üö® BITCOIN SUPPLY CRUNCH MAY BE COMING AS 40,000 BTC LEAVE EXCHANGES

üìâ I‚Äôm seeing something quietly bullish happening in Bitcoin, because since the start of January, around 36,000 to 40,000 BTC have been withdrawn from centralized exchanges based on on-chain data.

üè¶ This matters because exchange balances are now falling to some of the lowest levels in years, meaning fewer coins are sitting ‚Äúready to sell‚Äù on the spot market.

üßä When BTC leaves exchanges, it usually means people are moving into cold wallets, self-custody, or institutional custody, which is typically an accumulation signal, not a distribution one.

üìà The key impact is liquidity, because when supply on exchanges dries up the market becomes more shallow, so even a small demand boost can push price up way harder than expected.

ü™ô The ETF factor makes this even more interesting, because a big part of demand now flows through spot Bitcoin ETFs, and those BTC end up with custodians, not exchange balances so that the real demand can look ‚Äúinvisible‚Äù on normal volume metrics.

‚ö†Ô∏è But I‚Äôm also staying realistic, because outflows alone don‚Äôt guarantee a supply crunch, since BTC can always flow back to exchanges if price pumps and people decide to sell.

üß† My takeaway: if these exchange outflows continue while ETF and spot demand stay active, supply pressure can hit fast, and the market could get tighter than most people expect.

Why Bitcoin Liquidity Matters in 2026

Bitcoin remains the most liquid asset in the crypto market, serving as the primary benchmark for price discovery and market sentiment. In 2026,  $BTC liquidity is concentrated on a small group of large centralized exchanges where deep order books, tight spreads, and consistent execution allow traders to enter and exit positions efficiently. Strong Bitcoin liquidity reduces slippage on large orders, improves risk management, and ensures more stable pricing during periods of high volatility.

How to Evaluate Liquidity for Bitcoin Trading

For Bitcoin traders, liquidity goes beyond reported trading volume. Key indicators include order book depth within 1‚Äì2% of the mid-price, which determines how easily large BTC orders can be filled without moving the market. Spread stability during sharp price movements is another critical signal, as reliable BTC liquidity should remain tight even during news-driven volatility. Since derivatives now dominate BTC trading activity, exchanges with deep BTC perpetual futures markets often lead price discovery, while spot BTC markets remain essential for ownership, settlement, and long-term positioning.
